title: Lego Ski Resort
review: I thought it was a great set to build. Fits in with some of the creator seasonal sets for Christmas as a display.

author: chief7575
title: Breezy to build, lots of fun to play!
review:
So, our family has had our eye on this set for a while.  Finally, got it at a bit of a discount at Target, a few weeks ago.  With 11 mini-figs, plus a dog and a buildable snowman, you are not shorted on the amount of figures to play with.

Pros - while the builds on this one are not at all difficult, it was very nice that I was able to build any of these vignettes with my 6-year-old daughter.  Plus, the variety of things to build was fantastic!  While we have plenty of helicopters already, I do like the color scheme of this one.  

The Ski Patrol building/lodge is neat, with the first aid station and I like how they designed the roof.  It's a fun build and gives different ideas on how to build a smaller building for play.  

The Ski/Snowboard Sport shop is something new as well, as our growing LEGO city didn't have a feature like this before.  I like how a sideways railing was used to store the snowboards!  

There is no lack of snow gear available either, with skis, poles, snowboards and gear in abundance!

The snack shop is pretty standard, but fits in well with any winter theme

The half pipe and rail are new to us as well and pose a ton of play elements!  Especially when you wipe out and need to be rescued by the medical team on their snowmobile.  That's a great vehicle, with the stretcher on the trailer.  Simple but effective.

And finally, the snowplow is fantastic.  I always look forward to different service vehicles for our city and this is brilliant.  I love the front plow with the guards on it and it can carry extra gear in the back.  It might be my favorite item from this set.

Cons - Every set seems to have a helicopter, doesn't it?  The ski/skiboard shop is very front heavy and tips over very easily unless you have it secured to a bigger baseplate.  Same goes with the pipe run, it needs to be secured to something else.  If you start playing with these items on just the floor, they are definitely going to fall over.  Honestly, these are my only nit-picks with this set.  

Conclusion - I think this is a great set to acquire (especially at discount) if you want to add a variety of items and a slew of mini-figures to your winter layouts.  While there aren't any rare parts/pieces to be had, there are tons of fun in store!
